description:
PRAAT is a very flexible tool for speech analysis. It offers a wide range of standard and non-standard procedures including spectrographic analysis, articulatory synthesis, and neural networks.  There is simply no better package for linguists to use in analyzing speech.
    
### Features
* Speech analysis
* Speech synthesis
* Speech manipulation
* Listening experiments
* Labeling and segmentation
* Learning algorithms
* Statistics with principal compenent and discriminant analysis
* Produce quality graphics with integrated Mathematical and phonetics symbols
* Programmable with an easy scripting language
* Portable
* Configurable

For best results with phonetic characters in the TextGrid and Picture windows, you should also consider installing the [Charis SIL](https://chocolatey.org/packages/charissil) and/or the [Doulos SIL](https://chocolatey.org/packages/doulossil) fonts.

Much of the "official" documentation is not designed to help linguists (who may not have a strong phonetics background) get the measurements and make the changes that they need for research.  Thus, be sure to also look at the regularly-updated guidebook, [*Using Praat for Linguistic Research* by Will Styler](http://savethevowels.org/praat/) or [*Welcome to SWPhonetics* by Sidney Wood](https://swphonetics.com/praat/introduction/).
author: Paul Boersma,  David Weenink
